H0.text: Cleavage is the property that the student used to sort mineral samples into dull and shiny groups.

H1.text: Color is the property the student used to sort mineral samples into dull and shiny groups.

H2.text: Luster is the property the student used to sort the mineral samples into the dull and shiny groups.

H3.text: Streak is the property the student used to sort the mineral samples into dull and shiny groups.

A4.text: Lustre (Commonwealth English) or luster (American English; see spelling differences) is the way light interacts with the surface of a crystal, rock, or mineral.

A5.text: The terms are frequently combined to describe intermediate types of lustre (for example, a 'vitreous greasy' lustre).
